TypeSignature.Value: public abstract class XMLGregorianCalendar : Java.Lang.Object, IDisposable, Java.Lang.ICloneable
.class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit XMLGregorianCalendar extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Lang.ICloneable, class System.IDisposable
type XMLGregorianCalendar = class inherit Object interface ICloneable interface IJavaObject interface IDisposable

tr.th: Date/Time Datatype Field Mapping Between XML Schema 1.0 and Java Representation

tr.td:
getYear() is a value between -(10^9-1) to (10^9)-1 or .
is high order year value in billion of years.
getEon() has values greater than or equal to (10^9) or less than or equal to -(10^9). A value of null indicates field is undefined. Given that states that the year zero will be a valid lexical value in a future version of XML Schema, this class allows the year field to be set to zero. Otherwise, the year field value is handled exactly as described in the errata and [ISO-8601-1988]. Note that W3C XML Schema 1.0 validation does not allow for the year field to have a value of zero.

Independent of month, max range is 1 to 31 or .
The normative value constraint stated relative to month field's value is in .
0 to 24 or . For a value of 24, the minute and second field must be zero per .

from 0 to 60 or .
(Note: 60 only allowable for leap second.)
allows for infinite precision over the range from 0.0 to 1.0 when the is defined.
FractionalSecond is optional and has a value of null when it is undefined.
is the convenience millisecond precision of value of .
Number of minutes or . Value range from -14 hours (-14 * 60 minutes) to 14 hours (14 * 60 minutes).
